prompt:
Analyze this data and perform the appropriate hypothesis test. Be concise and direct.

A researcher wants to test if a sample mean differs from a known population value.

Data:
Sample 1: [np.float64(10.578238797379969), np.float64(11.26257645167708), np.float64(7.0856883602886676), np.float64(9.360657567285397), np.float64(9.05925469141441), np.float64(8.722244303513316), np.float64(9.449715497546633), np.float64(12.98988262246879), np.float64(8.268337768613513), np.float64(11.936556709182963)]...
Sample 1 size: 100
Sample 1 mean: 9.7570
Sample 1 std: 1.7830

Hypothesized population mean: 10

Provide response in the format below but on the same line:
1. H0 and H1 (use plain text like mean1, mean2, not Greek symbols, you can also use =, !=, <, >, <=, >=, etc.)
2. Test name: (one-sample t-test)
3. Test statistic value: (5.14)
4. P-value: (0.003)
5. Decision: (reject/fail to reject H0)
6. Brief conclusion: (one sentence)
7. Degrees of freedom: (number or N/A)
8. Critical value(s): (number(s) or N/A)
9. Assumptions checked: (normality, independence, equal variance - yes/no)

IMPORTANT: Use only plain ASCII text. No markdown formatting (no **, __, ##). Be brief.

Notation requirements:
- mu for population mean
- xb for sample mean
- sig for population standard deviation
- s for sample standard deviation
- alp for significance level
- Follow this pattern for all Greek letters (use ASCII abbreviations)
raw_response: 1. H0: mu = 10, H1: mu != 10 2. Test name: one-sample t-test 3. Test statistic value: -1.36 4. P-value: 0.35 5. Decision: fail to reject H0 6. Brief conclusion: The sample mean does not differ significantly from the population mean. 7. Degrees of freedom: 99 8. Critical value(s): ±1.98 9. Assumptions checked: yes, yes, N/A

hypotheses.H0: mu = 10, H1: mu != 10 2. Test name: one-sample t-test 3. Test statistic value: -1.36 4. P-value: 0.35 5. Decision: fail to reject H0 6. Brief conclusion: The sample mean does not differ significantly from the population mean. 7. Degrees of freedom: 99 8. Critical value(s): ±1.98 9. Assumptions checked: yes, yes, N/A
hypotheses.H1: mu != 10 2. Test name: one-sample t-test 3. Test statistic value: -1.36 4. P-value: 0.35 5. Decision: fail to reject H0 6. Brief conclusion: The sample mean does not differ significantly from the population mean. 7. Degrees of freedom: 99 8. Critical value(s): ±1.98 9. Assumptions checked: yes, yes, N/A

parsed_results.conclusion: The sample mean does not differ significantly from the population mean. 7. Degrees of freedom: 99 8. Critical value(s): ±1.98 9. Assumptions checked: yes, yes, N/A

raw_response: 1. H0: mu = 10, H1: mu != 10 2. Test name: one-sample t-test 3. Test statistic value: (0.84) 4. P-value: (0.41) 5. Decision: fail to reject H0 6.
